description.narrative: The overall project objective is to strategically position Cambodia’s path towards achieving the Sustainable Development Goals related to 1) natural resources management (NRM); 2) circular economy; and 2) clean, affordable and sustainable energy.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1. Output 1 Indicators: 1.1. Extent to which CBNRM institutions are strengthened 1.2. Number of total and female headed households benefit from CBNRM 1.3. Extent to which pilot PES approaches are operationalised for Kulen Mountain 1.4 Extent to which pilot PES approaches are operationalised for Kbal Chay 1.5. Extent to which a national PES policy is developed 1.6. Extent to which gender concerns are integrated into the proposed policy measures 1.7. Volume of financial resources mobilized to support proposed measures, measured in USD 1.8. Number of people with improved awareness on benefits of biodiversity and PES approach 1.9 Tree planting a COVID response indicators are set below: 1.9.1 Number of families being enrolled in income generating activities such as tree-planting, maintenance of forest plantation and nursery development (activity 1.8) 1.9.2 Number of Hectares new tree-plantation and number of Ha maintained 1.9.3 Dollars paid out as cash compensation for work under activity 1.8
2. Output 2 Indicators: 2.1. Extent to which a pilot is designed and implemented (municipality) 2.2. Extent to which a circular economy pilot is designed and implemented (industry) 2.3. Number of people outreached for raising awareness on appropriate waste management 2.4. Extent to which enabling policy measures are developed for the support of circular economy 2.5. Extent to which a private sector engagement strategy is designed and implemented 2.6. Volume of financial resources mobilised to support proposed waste management measures, measured in USD
3.Output 3 Indicators: 3.1 Solar PV energy business models developed and rolled out to provide electricity, incl. for productive use Measured by number of business models 3.2 Number of rural households benefit from solar PV system installed for access to energy incl. for productive use 3.3 Number of female headed households benefit from solar PV system installed for access to energy, water and productive

1. Targets of Output 1: 1.1 – 1= Some extent: Initial fund collection and distribution mechanism agreed 1.2 – 30 1.3 – 2= Moderate extent: PES operational mechanisms (including fund collection & management, implementation strategies and arrangements, and monitoring system) designed 1.4 – 2= Moderate extent: PES operational mechanisms (including fund collection & management, implementation strategies and arrangements, and monitoring system) designed 1.5 – 1= Moderate extent: Initial assessment and analysis 1.6 – 2= Moderate extent: relevant policy documents refer to their possible impacts on men and women and include some measures to ensure positive impacts 1.7 – 0 = None 1.8 – N/A= Not Applicable 1.9 – see below: 1.9.1 – 1,600 families enrolled in income generating activities such as tree planting and maintenance. 1.9.2 – 80 Ha new tree-planting and maintained 1.9.3 – USD100,000 paid out as compensation for work under Activity 1.8
2. Targets of Output 2: 2.1 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.2 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.3 – 400 people who received waste management information 2.4 – 2= Great extent: agreed set of measures receive government endorsement 2.5 – 1= Moderate extent: Strategy is designed but not implemented 2.6 – USD500K
3. Targets of Output 3: 3.1 – 2 = two Solar PV energy business models 3.2 – 100 households benefiting from solar 3.3 – 25 female headed households benefit from solar (revised) 3.4 – 20 technicians improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.5 – 40 community members improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.6 – 1 guideline developed 3.7 – N/A 3.8 – N/A 3.9 – N/A

1. Results of Output 1: 1.1 – 2 1.2 – 990 women attended in the tree planting activities 1.3 – 1 1.4 – 1 1.5 – 2 1.6 – 2 1.7 – $135K mobilized under GoAl Waters proposal 1.8 – 29,200 people reached through PES media campaigns in 2020 1.9 – see below: 1.9.1 – 2,114 workers enrolled in income generating activities such as tree planting and maintenance. 1.9.2 – 131 Ha new tree-planting and maintained 1.9.3 – $100,000 paid out as compensation for work under Activity 1.8
2. Results of Output 2: 2.1 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.2 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.3 – 203,029 people who received waste management information 2.4 – 2= Great extent: agreed set of measures receive government endorsement 2.5 – 1= Moderate extent: Strategy is designed but not implemented 2.6 – USD4 million for a 3-year combating marine plastic project and medical waste management
3. Results of Output 3: 3.1 –2 solar PV energy business models (DC micro-grids) 3.2 – 140 households benefiting from solar PV DC micro-grids 3.3 – 19 female headed households benefit from solar 3.4 – 21 technicians improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.5 – 30 community members improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.6 – 1 guideline developed 3.7 – N/A 3.8 – N/A 3.9 – N/A

Targets of Output 1: 1.1 – 2= Moderate extent: PES operational mechanisms (including fund collection & management, implementation strategies and arrangements, and monitoring system) designed 1.2 – 50 1.3 – 3=Great extent: PES operational mechanisms implemented 1.4 – 3=Great extent: PES operational mechanisms implemented 1.5 – 2= Great extent: final draft of policy ready for endorsement 1.6 – 2= Moderate extent: relevant policy documents refer to their possible impacts on men and women and include some measures to ensure positive impacts 1.7 – 100K 1.8 – 300 1.9 – see below: 1.9.1 – 0 1.9.2 – 160 Ha new tree-planting and maintained 1.9.3 – USD210,000 paid out as compensation for work under Activity 1.8

Targets of Output 2: 2.1 – 2=Great extent: Pilot is designed and implemented, with a business model tested and resulting data collected 2.2 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.3 – 600 people who received waste management information 2.4 – 2= Great extent: agreed set of measures receive government endorsement 2.5 – 2= Great extent: Strategy is operationalized including an online platform and pilot initiative 2.6 – USD500K

Targets of Output 3: 3.1 – 2 = two Solar PV energy business models 3.2 – 150 households benefiting from solar 3.3 – 50 female headed households benefit from solar (revised) 3.4 – 50 technicians improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.5 – 60 community members improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.6 – 1 guideline developed 3.7 – Yes 3.8 – 1 3.9 – see below (measured number of outreached by communication materials 3.9.a – 500 (2 videos) 3.9.b – 500 (1 Factsheet) 3.9.c – 50 (1 exhibition) 3.9.d – 50 (1 business talk) 3.9.e – 100 (2 consultative workshops)

These results are accumulated from 2019 to 2021 as below: 1. Results of Output 1: 1.1 – 2 1.2 – 513 female headed household benefited from the tree planting activities 1.3 – 2 1.4 – 1 1.5 – 2 1.6 – 2 1.7 – USD68K mobilized under GoAl Waters proposal for Kbal Chhay 1.8 – 33,700 people reached through PES media campaigns in 2020 1.9 – see below: 1.9.1 – 1,915 families 1.9.2 – 181.93 Ha 1.9.3 – USD196,084
2. Results of Output 2: 2.1 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.2 – 1= Moderate extent: Business model for pilot is designed, proposed, and consulted on with stakeholders 2.3 – Over 10 million viewers (1/3 females) 2.4 – 2= Great extent: agreed set of measures receive government endorsement 2.5 – 1= Moderate extent: Strategy is designed but not implemented 2.6 – almost USD4 million for a 3-year combating marine plastic project and medical waste management
3. Results of Output 3: 3.1 –2 solar PV energy business models (DC and AC mini grids), 4 business ideas 3.2 – 225 households (Men: 1270, Women: 344) 3.3 – 19 female headed households benefit from solar 3.4 – 73 (21 female technicians) improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.5 – 95 community members (34 females) improved their skills in design and installation of PV solar 3.6 – 1 solar home system guideline developed 3.7 – 4 policy briefs 3.8 – 1 3.9 – N/A
